recipes.label: The cat is playing with something
recipes.startdescription: The Scribe is reading at the desk when the Juniper jumps onto the desk, staring at them. It looks like the cat is up to something.

recipes.label: The cat snatched the coin!
recipes.startdescription: When Juniper sees that the Scribe is not paying attention, they push the coin off the edge of the desk, and starts chasing it. The coin lands facing up.
recipes.description: As the Scribe go retrieve the coin, they suddenly have a thought: What would happen if one flips the coin 100 times?

recipes.label: Tavern Kitchen: Brewer
recipes.startdescription: The Taverner is looking for ways to preserve or add flavor to the beer.

recipes.label: Taverner's Talk
recipes.startdescription: The Minstrel is absent-mindedly playing the lute and singing in the tavern, when they see the Taverner waves for them to come. The Minstrel hops down the stage, feeling dread in the stomach.

recipes.label: Taverner's Talk
recipes.startdescription: The Taverner threatens to deduct the Minstrel's wage again if they keeps playing so horribly.

recipes.label: Be the Tavern Keeper for Today
recipes.startdescription: The Taverner is telling people their sailing stories and bragging about their fishing skills. They start to get drunk. Their laughter fills the tavern.
recipes.description: The Taverner starts dancing to the music. They look rather foolish, dancing wobbly. Suddenly, they slip and fall onto the floor. The tavern roars with laughter.

recipes.label: Be the Tavern Keeper for Today
recipes.startdescription: The barley for bread has dwindled sharply. They say a war devoured all the stock. The tavern is also scarcely getting customers. A group of bandits were spotted in the forest south of the town. Fewer travelers are willing to pass by.
recipes.description: The Taverner sighed. They can only pray they catch enough fish now. Maybe they should not have spent so much on drinking last month.

recipes.label: Be the Tavern Keeper for Today
recipes.startdescription: The scribe is in a talkative mood today. They even listen to a few complaints about the rising wine taxes. The scribe always finds it amusing that their costumers keep coming back for their wine, since the scribe knows very well that the taverner adds vinegar into the wine…
recipes.description: In their delight, the scribe flips a coin in their hands. It lands facing up. They record down the result in the back of the ledger.

recipes.label: Be the Tavern Keeper for Today
recipes.startdescription: The scribe isn’t in the mood to chat with customers today and is busy checking the ledger.
recipes.description: There are a few suspicious spendings, obviously written by the Taverner. The Scribe decides to keep a closer eye on them with the increasing wine tax.

recipes.label: The Arbitrator's Name Day
recipes.startdescription: It is the Arbitrator's Name Day, and the Minstrel is busy preparing a surprise. When the Taverner begins to fret about the Minstrel turning the kitchen upside down, the Minstrel finally emerges with a cake in hand.

recipes.label: The Arbitrator's Name Day
recipes.startdescription: The Minstrel places the cake on the counter and vanishes beneath it, just as the Arbitrator walks into the tavern. The Scribes and the Taverner greets them, silently gesture towards the Minstrel's hiding place, and encourage the Arbitrator to give the cake a try.

recipes.label: The Arbitrator's Name Day
recipes.startdescription: The Arbitrator invites them all to share the cake. As they are busy dividing the cake, the Minstrel sneaks out. The Arbitrator suggests sharing the cake with the Minstrel, too.
recipes.description: The Minstrel sits down besides them, nervously waiting for the Arbitrator to give the cake a bite. The Arbitrator enjoys the cake very much and offers the Minstrel a piece to try. "It does taste good." thinks the Minstrel.

recipes.label: The Arbitrator's Name Day
recipes.startdescription: The Minstrel places the cake on the counter and vanishes beneath it, just as the Arbitrator walks into the tavern. The Scribe greets the Arbitrator and gestures towards the cake, saying the Minstrel made it for them. The Minstrel’s silently protests under the counter, but the Scribe ignores them.
recipes.description: Happily surprised, the Arbitrator gives it a try. They like the cake very much, although it tastes more milky than they expect. They joyfully thank the Minstrel, who reluctantly emerges from their hiding spot, feeling slightly happy, and utterly embarrassed.

recipes.label: The Arbitrator's Name Day
recipes.startdescription: The Minstrel places the cake on the counter and vanishes beneath it, just as the Arbitrator walks into the tavern. The Scribe greets the Arbitrator, suggesting them all to try the new dessert. The Arbitrator happily agrees.

recipes.label: The Arbitrator's Name Day
recipes.startdescription: All of them are enjoying the cake when the Minstrel finally sneaks out. The Arbitrator calls for the Minstrel to give it a try and says it’s the best cake they’ve ever had. "Really? I thought I added too much milk... oh no." The Minstrel catches themselves and blushes.
recipes.description: The Arbitrator takes the Minstrel’s hands into theirs and warmly expresses their appreciation. They share the rest of the cake. "It is indeed the best cake." thinks the Minstrel.

recipes.label: The Arbitrator's Name Day
recipes.startdescription: The Minstrel places the cake on the counter and vanishes beneath it, just as the Arbitrator walks into the tavern. The Taverner greets the Arbitrator and winks meaningfully, gesturing towards the cake.

recipes.label: The Arbitrator's Name Day
recipes.startdescription: The Arbitrator invites them all to share the cake. The Taverner decides to go fetch some wine and checkes the kitchen. There are a few jars and cups knocked over, but not too bad. In relief, the Taverner walks back out.
recipes.description: They grin as they see the Arbitrator is feeding a spoonful of cake to the Minstrel. The Taverner jokingly asks the Scribe to do the same. What they get is a plain rejection.

recipes.label: The Arbitrator's Name Day
recipes.startdescription: The Minstrel places the wobbly looking cake on the counter and vanishes beneath it, just as the Arbitrator walks into the tavern. The Taverner greets the Arbitrator and winks meaningfully, gesturing towards the cake.

recipes.label: The Arbitrator's Name Day
recipes.startdescription: The Arbitrator invites them all to share the cake. The Taverner decides to go fetch some wine and checkes the kitchen. The kitchen is an absolute mess. Bowls and jars are knocked over, cream and milk is smeared everywhere.
recipes.description: The Taverner frowns disapprovingly. They start to feel that buying those ingredients for the Minstrel to make the cake is a mistake.
